result.execSummary:
The defendant Thomas L Stephan was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: With Huber. Sentence credit of 3 days were granted if imposed.

miscConds.notes: Cash bail applied to costs, paid in full.

Follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered.
Sign releases for agent.

No Contact with co-actors or residence listed in the criminal complaint. Maintain employment and/or school combination. Follow through with any treatment or counseling recommended by agent. 
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: Non-working hours, release for standard conditions. STAYED for use at agent's discretion.

records.addlTxt: Wis. Dept. of Corrections notice of case status change received.  Outstanding financial obligations have been satisfied.

Defendant Thomas L Stephan in court with Attorney Timothy T. Kay.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Katrina Seipel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for sentencing hearing.  State gives sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Kay makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #4:  IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:   

45 DAYS HUBER (CREDIT - 3 days)

TERM OF PROBATION:  1 YEAR

CONDITIONS OF PROBATON:  
____No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia 
____No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
____Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are 
prescribed/sign releases.
____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
____Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
____No contact with: Co-actors or residence listed in criminal complaint

COSTS:  $243.00 (to be paid out of cash bail posted and remainder to be refunded to poster)

CONDITION TIME:   15 Days, Non-working hours with standard release conditions - STAYED - to be used at agent's discretion


COUNT #5:   IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:   

5 DAYS HUBER   **CONSECUTIVE TO COUNT #4**

TERM OF PROBATION:  1 YEAR

CONDITIONS OF PROBATON:  
____No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia 
____No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
____Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are 
prescribed/sign releases.
____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
____Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
____No contact with: Co-actors or residence listed in criminal complaint

COSTS:  $243.00 (to be paid out of cash bail posted and remainder to be refunded to poster)
Sentencing hearing on July 27, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Thomas L Stephan in court with Attorney Timothy T. Kay.  Lindsey Hirt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for motion hearing, however Attorney Kay moves to withdraw both motions.   Court grants request.  Defendant enters a no contest plea to Counts #4 & 5.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Counts #4 & 5.  Count #3 is dismissed and read-in.  Attorney Kay requests a sentencing date.  Bail remains as fixed. 
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 27, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Thomas L Stephan in court with Attorney Timothy T. Kay.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Becky Van Dam appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Kay requests an adjournment as Defendant has changed his mind as to plea.  Court leaves motion, jury status and jury trial dates on as set.   Bail remains as fixed.
Jury trial - 12 person on July 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Jury status hearing on July 16, 2015 at 09:30 am.
Plea hearing on May 15, 2015 at 03:45 pm.

Defendant Thomas L Stephan in court with attorney Timothy T. Kay.  Lesli Boese appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Kay states that a Motion date has already been set for 06/08/15. Atty Kay requests a plea/sentencing date to have time to discuss case with client. Court sets for plea hearing, jury status, and jury trial. Bail remains as fixed.  Plea hearing scheduled for May 15, 2015 at 03:45 pm.  Jury status hearing scheduled for July 16, 2015 at 09:30 am.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for July 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Motion hearing on June 8, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Motion to suppress involuntary statements-lack of miranda and Motion to suppress fruits of vehicle search - no search warrant. Filed by Atty Kay.

Defendant Thomas L Stephan in court with Attorney Timothy T. Kay.  Lesli S Boese appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for motion hearing - motion for severance.  Attorney Kay makes statements regarding motion.  State gives statements regarding motion for severance.  Attorney Kay makes additional statements.  Court denies motion for severance for reasons stated on the record.  Court addresses motion to preclude state's witness filed by Attorney Kay on 4/8/15.  State makes statements regarding motion.  Attorney Kay makes no statements.  Court holds this motion for further consideration at the jury status, if needed.  Court leaves case on for jury status and jury trial as set.
Motion to preclude State's expert Witness. Filed by Atty Kay.
Filed by the State.
Motion hearing on April 9, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
Motion for severance of defendants and for separate trial; filed by Attorney Timothy Kay
Jury trial - 12 person on May 5, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Jury status hearing on April 30, 2015 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Thomas L Stephan in court with Attorney Timothy T. Kay.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Christine Bohn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Kay requests a jury status and jury trial date.  Attorney Kay states he will be filing motion to sever. Court sets jury trial and jury status dates.    Bail remains as fixed.  Jury status hearing scheduled for April 30, 2015 at 09:30 am.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for May 5, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Transcript received and filed for the following date and event: January 8, 2015 for Preliminary Hearing and Arraignment (Digital Recording), presiding Court Commissioner Thomas J. Pieper.
Hearing on February 16, 2015 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Thomas L Stephan in court with attorney Timothy T. Kay.  Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Detective Jack K. from the Waukesha County Sheriff's Department was sworn and testified on the behalf of the state. Cross examination by the defense. State rests. No testimony by the defense. State moves for bind over and presents arguments. Defense objects.   Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.   NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED. 
  Hearing scheduled for February 16, 2015 at 10:30 am.
